snippet: On Monday Seattle raised its minimum wage to $15 an hour. But can the city afford it? Will it lead to job losses, as some predict, or be a model for national reform?
abstract: On Monday Seattle raised its minimum wage to $15 an hour. But can the city afford it? Will it lead to job losses, as some predict, or be a model for national reform?

headline.main: Can the Minimum Wage Be Too High?
